result.execSummary:
The defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zaidah Angelyn Mosley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zaidah Angelyn Mosley was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence; with credit for 84 days (5-29-2015 to 6-12-2015 and 10-01-2015 to 12-09-2015) time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DOES NOT appear. Tyrone M. St. Junior III appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Surety in Court. Bail arguments made; Court DENIED Surety's request for return of bail.
Bail remains FORFEITED.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-04-2016 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Maxine White. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 84 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 84days (5-29-2015 to 6-12-2015 and 10-01-2015 to 12-09-2015) time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
Case set in branch 47 on 12-09-2015 an error, cases to be heard in branch 17.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to branch 7.

BRANCH 7 FOR BRANCH 17.  Defendant Zaidah A Mosley in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Zaidah A Mosley in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Defendant requests jury trial.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 17. Court preapproves transfer to branch 17 for global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's at 2500 N Mayfair Road

Defendant Zaidah Angelyn Mosley not in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant had Justice Point violation, however, Defendant absconded from Justice Point prior to appearing in court.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
